WYSIWYM.transformer
Class SemanticGraphTransformer

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.transformer.GraphTransformer
      WYSIWYM.transformer.SemanticGraphTransformer
Direct Known Subclasses:
FeedbackTextGenerator, TextFrame
public class SemanticGraphTransformer
extends GraphTransformer

SemanticGraphTransformer performs operations on the SemanticGraph. It will not add components who share their id with other components in the graph!

Version:
1.1 20-10-2006, 1.2 15-02-2008
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

addNode

public boolean addNode(Node node,
                       boolean hasID)
Adds the node and then sets its Sesame ID. hasID should be true if the node already has a Sesame id.

Overrides:
addNode in class GraphTransformer
Parameters:
node - Node
hasID - True if node already has a Sesame ID
Returns:
false if the node was already in the Graph, otherwise true

removeSequence

public Anchor removeSequence(int seq,
                             OntologyReader oa)
Implements the undo-function, by searching the last added or changed nodes and edges in the graph, and either removing them or undoing the changes.

Parameters:
seq - The number of the last operation
oa - Ontology
Returns:
Anchor. In some cases an anchor that was deleted will be regenerated.

printGraph

public void printGraph()
Prints the semantic graph to a text file in dot format, so it can be visualised with GraphViz

printGraph

public void printGraph(String fileName)
Prints the semantic graph to a text file with the given name in .dot format, so it can be visualised with GraphViz

Parameters:
fileName - Filename

makeEdge

public SGEdge makeEdge(String label)
Function for QueryBuilder to overload. Ensures that edges of the proper kind (QueryEdges for a QueryGraph, SGEdges for SemanticGraph) are created.

Parameters:
label - Property label
Returns:
SGEdge

makeEdge

public SGEdge makeEdge(String label,
                       SGNode source,
                       SGNode target)
                throws NameAlreadyBoundException
Function for QueryBuilder to overload. Ensures that edges of the proper kind (QueryEdges for a QueryGraph, SGEdges for SemanticGraph) are created.

Parameters:
label - Property label
source - Source of edge
target - Target of edge
Returns:
SGEdge
Throws:
NameAlreadyBoundException - if either node already has an edge with the new edge's ID
